Unit tests test a single unit
of functionality at a time.
In most cases, that unit is a function.

With unit tests, we can
define the requirements
for a function in code.
For example, my unit test might validate

that when I call my function

If that assertion is correct

Teams can automate their unit test to run

change to the function

change from being submitted
until all the related unit tests pass.
This effectively enforces the requirements

accidentally break things
